docs.lead_paragraph: It took a long time for disabled drivers to get up to speed.

headline.main: Modern Mobility Shifts Into the Fast Lane

docs.abstract: These days, disabled drivers can get modern cars and trucks retrofitted with hand controls and other adaptive devices. But it wasn't always this way, and disabled drivers have had their choice of strange specialty vehicles.
docs.snippet: These days, disabled drivers can get modern cars and trucks retrofitted with hand controls and other adaptive devices. But it wasn't always this way, and disabled drivers have had their choice of strange specialty vehicles.

docs.lead_paragraph: Prita Mulyasari, a 32-year-old mother of two, has earned the support of many in Indonesia after an e-mail she wrote complaining about a hospital landed her in jail.

headline.main: Trapped Inside a Broken Judicial System After Hitting Send

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts question the value of the expensive lymphoma drug Folotyn, which shrinks tumors but has not been shown to prolong lives.

headline.sub: Cost of Drugs Is Soaring,  Defying Reform   ;

docs.lead_paragraph: At least two coalitions of senators are trying to tackle perhaps the biggest question looming over the Democrats' health care legislation: whether the bill would be aggressive enough to slow seemingly out-of-control health care costs for both the federal government and average Americans. One group -- consisting of Senators Susan Collins, Republican of Maine, right; Joseph I. Lieberman, independent of Connecticut, left; and Arlen Specter, Democrat of Pennsylvania, center -- boasted of being ''tripartisan.'' At a news conference on Friday, the three lawmakers said they would join forces on a package of amendments that would save the government $8 billion over 10 years.
docs.abstract: At least two coalitions of senators are trying to tackle perhaps biggest question looming over Democrats' health care legislation: whether bill would be aggressive enough to slow seemingly out-of-control health care costs for federal government and average Americans; Sens Susan Collins, Joseph I Lieberman and Arlen Specter say they will join forces on package of amendments that would save government $8 billion over 10 years; photo (M)
